english.segment1: My first day of recess. They all laughed at me. When I fell off the swing set. And scraped up my knee
english.segment2: The nurse called my Momma. To say I'd be late, And when she gave me the phone. I could hear Momma say. "I'm so sorry, son. Oh I think you're' so brave"
english.segment3: And she was smilin when she said:
english.segment4: When you come home, No matter how far, Run through the door. And into my arms. It's where you are loved, It's where you belong. And I will be here. When you come home
english.segment5: I waved good-bye through the window. As I boarded the plane, My first job in Houston. Was waiting for me
english.segment6: I found a letter from Momma. Tucked in my coat. And as I flew down the runway. I smiled when she wrote: I'll miss you, son, You'll be so far away
english.segment7: But I'll be waiting for the day
english.segment8: When you come home. No matter how far, Run through the door. And into my arms. It's where you are loved, It's where you belong, And I will be here. When you come home
english.segment9: Well, I don't think. She can hear you now, The doctor told me. Your mother is fading, It's best that you leave
english.segment10: So I whispered, I love you. And then turned away. But I stopped at the door. When I heard Momma say, I love you, son, But they're callin me away
